source: Delaware 211, Delaware Department of Veterans Affairs, Delaware Joining Forces

resources.name: Delaware 211
resources.description: Delaware's 24-hour free and confidential helpline available in multiple languages. Connects residents to critical local resources including veteran services, housing, employment, and benefits assistance.

resources.name: Delaware Department of Veterans Affairs
resources.description: State agency supporting veterans and their families with access to federal and state benefits including disability compensation, employment, housing, and more

resources.name: People's Place Veterans Outreach
resources.description: Offers referrals for counseling, Department of Labor employment counseling, assistance with military discharge form DD-214, and identifies and places homeless veterans in shelters with referrals to VA HUD-VASH coordinators

resources.name: Victory Village Veteran's Center
resources.description: Provides comprehensive support services for veterans, service members, and their families to ease transition from military to civilian life

resources.name: Delaware Supportive Services for Veteran Families (SSVF)
resources.description: Provides case management, benefit application assistance, and financial assistance for rental, security deposit, and utility costs to veterans experiencing housing instability or homelessness

resources.name: Delaware Veterans Trust Fund
resources.description: Assists Delaware veterans in financial crisis with healthcare requirements, housing assistance, and educational or training programs

resources.name: Delaware Center for Homeless Veterans, Inc. (DCHV)
resources.description: Provides safe and affordable permanent housing coupled with supportive services using the Housing First Model, offering services from emergency shelter to permanent housing with intensive case management

resources.name: Wilmington VA Regional Benefit Office
resources.description: Federal VA office administering compensation, pension, education, and other benefits for Delaware veterans and their families

resources.name: Delaware Joining Forces
resources.description: Network of state agencies and external service providers providing solutions for military members, veterans and families. Maintains comprehensive directory of community groups, service providers, hospitals, centers, and businesses

resources.name: Veterans Crisis Line
resources.description: 24/7 free confidential crisis support for veterans and families experiencing mental health crises, PTSD, suicidal thoughts
